title: Under Siege, Jared Kushner Goes on the Attack
content:
Speaking aboard Air Force One on his way to celebrate equality , liberty , and fraternity in France , Donald Trump turned his attention to the interlinked problems currently plaguing his presidency : paternity and Putin . Explaining that he only recently found out that his son Donald Jr. and son-in-law Jared Kushner had met with a Kremlin-connected lawyer in the hope of scoring damaging information about Hillary Clinton , he downplayed the entire Russian imbroglio as overhyped . “ What do you do ? End up in a fistfight ? ” he joked , describing his apparently ineffectual attempt to get Vladimir Putin to confess to election interference when the two met in Hamburg , Germany , last week . Back in Washington , however , the mood at the White House was hardly bucolic . While the president ’ s inner circle has not yet descended into physical fist-fighting , the West Wing has been hard hit by a storm of suspicion and sparring , with Kushner reportedly at its center .
Citing six sources familiar with the matter , Politico reports that Kushner has pushed for the White House to respond to the unfolding Donnygate drama with more force but has been met with resistance from a raft of Trump ’ s top aides , some of whom argue the issue is an outside matter , and should thus be dealt with externally . Kushner disagrees , arguing that , as the scandal affects Trump ’ s presidency , it should be handled with urgency by the in-White House communications shop .
It is not hard to divine the shadow of an agenda . If the impact of the meeting with Natalia Veselnitskaya on Trump ’ s presidency is not yet quantifiable , the impact it has on Kushner ’ s reputation seems more immediately tangible . Eagerly seeking out Russian-sponsored intelligence on Clinton makes Trump Jr. look moronic , but it makes Kushner , who works in the White House , looks utterly shady , especially since he neglected to mention the meeting on a security form back in January , when he originally applied for clearance . ( Veselnitskaya has denied having ties to the Kremlin . )
Apparently , the omission was a regular mishap administered by a clumsily fingered aide , who managed to hit the send key before the form was completed . In the spirit of team Trump ’ s newfound interest in transparency , Kushner ’ s lawyers have said that he notified the F.B.I . within 12 hours of the error , and said he would make the necessary amendments . These reportedly came on May 11 , when Kushner added more than 100 meetings with foreign officials from 20 countries , including those with Russian ambassador to the U.S. Sergey Kislyak ( to whom Trump recently released classified information boasting he gets “ great intel ” ) , and the head of a Russian state-owned bank .
Kushner ’ s lawyers are reportedly confident that this latest torsion won ’ t raise any additional problems , because Kushner clean forgot about the meeting ( he was allegedly present only briefly , anyway ) , and had no intention to conceal it . As his lawyer , Jamie Gorelick said in a statement : “ Mr . Kushner has submitted additional [ federal disclosure ] updates and included , out of an abundance of caution , this meeting with a Russian person , which he briefly attended at the request of his brother-in-law , Donald Trump Jr. As Mr. Kushner has consistently stated , he is eager to cooperate and share what he knows . ”
Kushner does not seem to be so placid . While not equipped with an exact and overall strategy , inside sources have described the president ’ s son-in-law as calling for full combat with the media , suggesting phoning journalists to offer the White House response to reports , and placing op-eds in national papers . One senior administration official suggested that two aides from the communications shop be dedicated to updating chyrons . “ Jared did n't like the idea ; he wanted people to get aggressive , ” said an outside adviser briefed on the meeting . “ Jared ’ s the guy who is rushing the front lines , and other people are saying , 'see , wait , hold , and let ’ s get a battle strategy . ’ ”
